txt.en: Instance: A True Friend of Durin's Folk
'We will not need to fight side by side on this day, [placeholder], as we did before. This is a day for celebration!'
'It has been too long since I have addressed you, my people.'

'I could have told the king you were worthy of praise when you first arrived and saved you some time... but no one asked me, after all! Ha ha ha!\n\n'Well-done, [placeholder]! You have done much for my people!'
'We have been through much. The time could not be spared.'
'Our allies were set upon by their foes, and Durin's Folk came to their defence.'

'I could have told the king you were worthy of praise when you first arrived and saved you some time... but no one asked me, after all! Ha ha ha!\n\n'Well-done, [placeholder]! You have done much for our people!'
'My father died before the gates. Many of our people perished by his side.'
'Our home was besieged.'
'We persevered! We did not give up!'
'We took up axe and shield, and faced our enemies!'
King Thorin III has called for the folk of the Lonely Mountain to assemble and hear his words.
'The Dark Lord was destroyed, and the gates of his land were cast down.'
'Into Mordor our people journeyed, eager for treasure and glory.'
Hrostyr stands before the throne of King Thorin III.
Thorin III, King Under the Mountain, addresses the folk of the Lonely Mountain.
'Thorin III, King Under the Mountain, has some words for you all.'
'But that land still holds danger for our people.'
'Dómor succumbed to the evils of Mordor, and betrayed his fellows.'
'Now he rots in the dungeons of the Mountain.'
Talk to Hrostyr
'I will deal with Dómor.'
'Glory for the King Under the Mountain!'
Listen to the words of Thorin III, King Under the Mountain
'But do not forget Eirek and Mogi, who fell at his hands.'
'Thorin! Thorin!'
'There is another who has worked on behalf of Durin's Folk.'
'I speak of [placeholder]. Come stand with me, my friend.'
'Our king!'
'You braved the darkness of Mordor and emerged untainted.'
'Death to the traitor!'
'Your deeds speak loudly of your courage and your bravery.'
'He has no honour!'
'You are a true friend of Durin's Folk!'
'His beard should be shorn!'
'[placeholder]!'
